Controlling Post-Battle Stat Gains
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Battles: Controlling Post-Battle Stat Gains
By RNA on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 01:02 am:

Okay, I've gotten a hook on something that may revolutionize the game: I think I've figured out how to control the "lessons" that your monster learns after battles, to a degree! Before choosing to go to a battle (while still on the ranch), go to Drill and select three different light drills, backing out of each one, and then go back and choose to enter the battle. After the tournament's over, the stats associated with two of those three drills will be among your monster's gains! In other words, if you choose Power, Defense, and Speed, then two of those three (never just one, never all three, from what I've seen) will be in your boosts! This means that while raising a Wracky, you could just keep choosing Power, Skill, and whatever else you feel like working on, and roughly force your monster to get decent stat gains in those areas through enough battles! As a disclaimer, it's really hard to get into the habit of doing, and I haven't tested it seriously with any other monster than the one I'm currently working on, but it's still something to pay attention to!

-- Nate Railsback (ChimeraMan101@aol.com), February 12, 2000

Answers

Oh yeah, and before anyone states that this just may be random chance....there's a 1/40 chance that the two of the three drills you chose would be in the post-battle score, and this happens to me every time I've thought to try it, so I really do think that this is more than random chance.

-- Nate Railsback (ChimeraMan101@aol.com), February 12, 2000.

I figured out another way of controlling the "lessons" that your monster gains after battle. I simply reload and do the battle all over again if I don't get the stat(s) that I wanted. Works pretty much 50% of the time, from what I've noticed.
Someone on fade's board thought that your gains after battle correspond to what you do during battle. (ie, getting hit too many times = increase in DEF or SPD)
